Appearance
From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

English

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From i- +‎ phone. Many Apple products have an i- prefix in their names.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (US):(file)
  • (US) IPA(key): /ˈaɪˌfoʊ̯n/
  • Homophone: eyephone

Noun

[edit]

iPhone (plural iPhones)

  1. (trademark) A smartphone of a series produced by Apple, which typically combine a camera phone, PDA, multimedia player, and wireless communication device.
    Synonym: (humorous) Jesus phone
    Hypernym: smartphone
    His mom bought him an IPhone for his 11th birthday.
    • 2012, “Best iPhone 5 concept photos”, in CNet:
      This concept puts the curve back on the iPhone 5 with a silhouette that's reminiscent of a banana phone.
    • 2020 July 9, Jacob Krol, “Here’s how to get the iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 public beta”, in CNN‎[2], archived from the original on 31 March 2023:
      Apple is rolling out the public beta of iOS 14 and iPadOS 14 on Thursday. We have a full (and lengthy) preview guide on both operating systems here, and now we’re breaking down how to get the public beta on your iPhone or iPad.
    • 2023 September 19, Yessenia Funes, quoting Robert D. Bullard, “The Father of Environmental Justice Exposes the Geography of Inequity”, in Scientific American‎[3], archived from the original on 20 December 2023:
      “This is before everyone had [geographic information system] mapping, before iPads, iPhones, laptops, Google,” he says. “This is doing research way back with a hammer and a chisel.”
  2. (by extension) Any knockoff or similar high-end smartphone; through trademark genericization.

Coordinate terms

[edit]
  • iPad
  • iPod
  • iMac
  • iDevice

Derived terms

[edit]
  • iPhone moment
  • iPhoneography
  • iPhoner

Chinese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English iPhone.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Mandarin
    (Pinyin): āifèng
    (Zhuyin): ㄞ ㄈㄥˋ
  • Cantonese (Jyutping): aai1 fung1
  • Wu (Shanghai, Wugniu): 1e-fon
  • Mandarin
    • (Standard Chinese)+
      • Hanyu Pinyin: āifèng
      • Zhuyin: ㄞ ㄈㄥˋ
      • Tongyong Pinyin: aifòng
      • Wade–Giles: ai1-fêng4
      • Yale: āi-fèng
      • Gwoyeu Romatzyh: aifenq
      • Palladius: айфэн (ajfɛn)
      • Sinological IPA (key): /ˀaɪ̯⁵⁵ fɤŋ⁵¹/
  • Cantonese
    • (Standard Cantonese, Guangzhou–Hong Kong)+
      • Jyutping: aai1 fung1
      • Yale: āai fūng
      • Cantonese Pinyin: aai1 fung1
      • Guangdong Romanization: ai1 fung1
      • Sinological IPA (key): /aːi̯⁵⁵ fʊŋ⁵⁵/
  • Wu
    • (Northern: Shanghai)
      • Wugniu: 1e-fon
      • MiniDict: e平 fon
      • Wiktionary Romanisation (Shanghai): 1e-fon
      • Sinological IPA (Shanghai): /e⁵⁵ foŋ²¹/

Noun

[edit]

iPhone

  1. iPhone (the Apple iPhone)
  2. iPhone (a smartphone)

Danish

[edit]
Danish Wikipedia has an article on:
iPhone
Wikipedia da

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English iPhone.

Noun

[edit]

iPhone c (singular definite iPhonen, plural indefinite iPhones)[1]

  1. iPhone

Declension

[edit]
Declension of iPhone
common
gender 		singular plural
indefinite definite indefinite definite
nominative iPhone iPhonen iPhones iPhonesene
genitive iPhones iPhonens iPhones' iPhonesenes

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from English iPhone.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /aj.fɔn/, /i.fɔn/
  • Audio (France (Saint-Maurice-de-Beynost)):(file)
  • Audio (France):(file)

Noun

[edit]

iPhone m (plural iPhones)

  1. iPhone (the Apple iPhone)
  2. iPhone (any smartphone)
    Synonyms: smartphone, ordiphone

iPhone n (proper noun, strong, genitive iPhones)

  1. iPhone

Hungarian

[edit]
 iPhone on Hungarian Wikipedia

Etymology

[edit]

From English iPhone.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): [ˈaːjfoːn]
  • Rhymes: -oːn

Noun

[edit]

iPhone (plural iPhone-ok)

  1. (trademark) iPhone (a smartphone of a series produced by Apple)

Declension

[edit]

Polish

[edit]
Polish Wikipedia has an article on:
iPhone
Wikipedia pl

Etymology

[edit]

Unadapted borrowing from English iPhone.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /ˈaj.fɔn/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Rhymes: -ajfɔn
  • Syllabification: i‧Phone

Noun

[edit]

iPhone m animal

  1. iPhone (smartphone of a series produced by Apple Inc., which typically combine a camera phone, PDA, multimedia player, and wireless communication device)

Declension

[edit]
Declension of iPhone
singular plural
nominative iPhone iPhone'y
genitive iPhone'a iPhone'ów
dative iPhone'owi iPhone'om
accusative iPhone'a iPhone'y
instrumental iPhone'em iPhone'ami
locative iPhonie iPhone'ach
vocative iPhonie iPhone'y

Further reading

[edit]
  • iPhone in Polish dictionaries at PWN

Noun

[edit]

iPhone m (plural iPhones)

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Unadapted borrowing from English iPhone.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /aiˈfon/ [ai̯ˈfõn]
  • Rhymes: -on

Noun

[edit]

iPhone m (plural iPhones)

  1. iPhone
    • 2015 October 28, “Google tiene 3,8 millones de GB de nuestras fotos”, in CNN en Español‎[4]:
      Necesitarías cuando menos 238,080 iPhones S6 con 16 gigabytes de memoria para guardarlas.
      (please add an English translation of this quotation)
